item.title: Email Delivery Issues (Re: Proofpoint)
item.content:encoded:
Sep 9, 14:23 UTC
Resolved - As reported by AWS: "Our internal service team had contacted Proofpoint regarding unblocking the IP address, and the Proofpoint team has informed that these blocks have been lifted on Sept 8 1:28PM PST.  " Email delivery should, therefore, now be resolved. To avoid these issues in the future, the Cloudsmith team will investigate the use of permanent Dedicated IPs in the future instead.

Proofpoint has erroneously flagged one of the IPs we utilize for sending email, impacting delivery to those servers. Proofpoint has already raised a ticket for the issue, and we await a resolution. Meanwhile, we're exploring an alternative route to bypass the delivery issues.

item.title: Access Log Export Gaps + Reduced Billing Charges
item.content:encoded:
Sep 7, 17:00 UTC
Resolved - Between the 2nd of August 2023 and the 7th of September 2023, we experienced a considerable reduction in access/usage log processing due to a change by our Cloud hosting provider, resulting in missed data for both access log exports (to your object storage) for customers and reduced metrics for billing purposes (resulting in reduced charges for the month).

The root cause was fixed, restoring processing for any logs beyond that. Still, we're currently in the process (as of the 5th of October) of orchestrating a backfill process to restore this data for customers fully. The intended completion date is mid to late October; we'll write a communication to detail progress later. A retrospective and post-mortem will be conducted at a point closer to the completion of the backfill.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us anytime.

item.title: RedHat Package Checksums Failures
item.content:encoded:
Apr 29, 09:18 UTC
Resolved - The issue has now been resolved, and any/all affected checksums for RedHat packages have been automatically recalculated. If you encounter any further issues, please try clearing any local caches first (e.g. for yum, using "yum clean all").

Apr 28, 11:03 UTC
Monitoring - We have identified and are currently verifying a fix for an issue raised by a subset of customers distributing RedHat packages

The symptoms are, when a package has been uploaded and get signed by Cloudsmith, the checksum for the package isn't fully updated post-signature, and when clients attempt to retrieve the package with checksum validation, it fails to validate with the following:

"Downloading successful, but checksum doesn't match. Calculated: Expected "

A fix has been implemented to resolve the issue, but as it only affects a subset of customers, we're still in the process of verifying this has been fully fixed. A workaround mitigation is that a resync of the package will fix the issue. Once we fully validate the fix, we'll determine if we can backfill a fix for all affected packages.

Feb 23, 12:00 UTC
Resolved - On February 23rd, between 12:00 and 13:03 UTC, a portion of traffic to the service experienced slower response times and eventually started receiving timeout responses.

This was caused by infrastructure instability in a handful of web server instances, causing slowdowns in requests being processed, which led to longer times to service requests, ultimately causing multiple web server instances to be replaced, further amplifying the problem.

The situation was resolved by scaling our infrastructure to handle the backlog of requests and return the service to normal operation.

No data has been lost, and once the incident has been resolved we'll be able to reprocess all packages for file/folder display as normal. We do not yet have any information to provide on a possible timeline for resolution.
